summary: A memo requesting covert training for members of the Venezuelan Armed Forces Intelligence Service (SIFA) to improve their capabilities in combating communist activities and enhancing liaison relationships with the CIA.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum requests covert training for four members of the Venezuelan Armed Forces Intelligence Service (SIFA) from March to April 1965. The training, requested by the Venezuelan Desk of Branch Three of WH Division, aims to improve SIFA's efficiency and internal security to combat communist activities, particularly those encouraged by Cuba. The trainees will operate under the cover of military training courses or a purchasing mission, avoiding formal liaison visits or meetings with Agency officials, except for a one-day training session at the R & S Building. The responsible desk operations officer, Mr. William E. Cavan (alias "Bill Cabal"), will be the point of contact, and the training will cover clandestine activities, security, surveillance, agent acquisition, counterintelligence, interrogation, and intelligence research.
title: Covert Training for member of CIWOO organization
